entry.title: How to Get Top Dollar in Todays Sellers Market
entry.content:
If you want top dollar in todays sellers market, price your home according to market conditions.

Selling your Birmingham home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Birmingham home? Search all homes for sale

Today Im excited to share with you some advice about how sellers can price their homes properly in a sellers market.

One of the things were seeing in the marketplace today is that it is absolutely a sellers market. 

However, I want to illustrate why I believe that its a sellers market that is kind of being held up on stilts. What I mean by that is that were not in a market where you can just throw any price on a house and expect it to sell. 

Were in a market where youve got to price your house according to the market conditions. By doing this, youre increasing the demand for the house. Buyers will want your house because the market is currently low on inventory of houses that are priced correctly, in good condition, and move-in ready. Meeting these criteria will increase the net money in your pocket.
Were in a market where youve got to price your house according to the market conditions.

Something weve observed in the marketplace is a number of homes that are being priced a little too aggressively. Both Realtors and sellers are thinking the market is a little stronger than it truly is.

What we want for all of our clients is for you to be able to get top dollar for your house in as little time as possible, and for you to put as much money in your pocket as you can. To do that, you need to work with a real estate professional who will sit down, analyze the numbers with you, come to an agreement on what price the market is positioning your home for, and list your home accordingly.

If you have any questions, just reach out to us and let us know what we can do to help you with your situation. If you have a topic that youd like us to cover, send it to us, and we would love to address it for you.

link.title: How to Get Top Dollar in Todays Sellers Market

entry.title: The Best Way to Win in a Competitive Market
entry.content:
How can you beat out other buyers in a competitive market? Today, Ive got some key tips that can help.

Selling your Birmingham home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Birmingham home? Search all homes for sale
How can you beat out other buyers in a competitive market?

Today, Id like to give you some information on how you can get the edge. What my team and I have found is that many buyers rely on websites like Zillow and Trulia to find their homes.

What I want to tell you now is to avoid making this mistake. Looking on third-party websites is not a good strategy. If youve ever found a property online, you may have had the unfortunate experience of calling your agent only to discover that the home has already gone under contract. 

My team and I have a different approach. We ask all of our buyers to come in so that we can really dig into what youre looking for and set you up with a service that we pay for. This service will give you instant access to home listings before most other buyers even become aware of them.  

One of the agents on our team recently helped a buyer get under contract before the property they were interested in even hit Zillow. We are able to do this because we have a team of agents who are always looking for properties. 

Ultimately, this is the secret to beating out the competition. To win in a competitive market, you have to get to properties before anyone else. Youll also need to be backed by a team of agents who can help you in the process.
To win in a competitive market, you have to get to properties first before anyone else.

If you have any other questions or would like more information, feel free to give me a call or send me an email. I look forward to hearing from you soon.

entry.title: The Perfect Storm for Home Sellers Is on the Horizon
entry.content:
This summer is shaping up to be the perfect storm for home sellers in our market. However, you need to act fast.

Selling your Birmingham home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Birmingham home? Search all homes for sale
If youve been considering selling your home, now is the time to do it. This summer is shaping up to be one of the most favorable seasons in recent years to sell your home quickly and for top dollar. 

However, this moment wont last forever. 

Mortgage rates are still very low. Right now, the 30-year mortgage rate has dipped to 3.9%, which is far from the 4.5% experts predicted for 2017. These continuing low mortgage rates translate into more affordable homes and eager buyers looking to lock in these low rates while they last. 

Weve seen this eagerness in action lately. Demand is so strong that home sales actually increased in both April and May, despite the fact that the supply of homes on the market is currently at a seven-year low. As a result of strong demand and tight inventory, home prices reached a record high this May, rising 6% compared to May 2016. It was the 63rd straight month of year-over-year gains.

What does this mean for you?
If youre thinking of selling your home, the time to do so is now.
These conditions make it very easy for you to sell your home right away for a very favorable price, but they also point to a correction which might appear soon in our market. For example, the increase in sales numbers is likely to push up mortgage rates, making it less affordable for buyers to buy. The ongoing Federal Reserve rate hike might contribute to this as well. 

Furthermore, the continuing demand and high home prices will eventually spur construction of new homes. The record-high confidence levels reported recently the National Association of Homebuilders support this. All this new construction will certainly impact the growth of home prices, and might even drive them down. 

So, again, if youre thinking of selling your home, the time to do so is now. 

If you have any questions about our current market or need help getting started on selling your home quickly and for top dollar, dont hesitate to give me a call at 205-536-9194 or send me an email at jason@jasonsecor.com. Id be happy to help.

entry.title: 4 Urgent Reasons to Put Your Home on the Market in 2017
entry.content:
There are four reasons why now is the perfect time to jump off the fence and put your home on the market.

Selling your Birmingham home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Birmingham home? Search all homes for sale
If youve been thinking about selling your home, now is the time to get off of the fence. There are four reasons why: 

1. Mortgage interest rates are rising. Interest rates have been historically low, so we all knew that this was coming. The Fed raised their rates by a quarter of a point, which will affect the mortgage rates. In fact, the Fed is expected to raise rates several more times this year, which will affect the number of buyers who can afford to purchase your home. 

2. Inventory is extremely low. Inventory is shrinking, which means you will have less competition and your home will be more valuable. 
Thanks to low inventory, your home is worth more money in our current market.
3. Home prices are rising. Buyer demand is incredibly high right now. That combined with low inventory and rising interest rates means that home prices are going up. 

4. Consumer confidence is on the rise. Thanks to an improving job market and economy, buyers are more confident about purchasing homes. 

So, if you are ready to jump off the fence, now is the time. If you have any other questions about our current market or the home selling process, give me a call or send me an email. I would be happy to help you!

link.title: 4 Urgent Reasons to Put Your Home on the Market in 2017

entry.title: How to Sell Faster and for More Money
entry.content:
We want to help you sell your home faster and for more money in 2017. Heres how we can help ensure a successful home sale.

Selling your Birmingham home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Birmingham home? Search all homes for sale


2017 is going to be a great year for real estate, and if youre thinking about selling, we want to help you sell your home as quickly as possible. 

There are a couple key factors in making sure your home gets sold quickly and for top dollar. 

The first is pricing. When we price a home, we look at the market data and figure out the range, low, median, and high. We then price the home on the lower end of that spectrum to make sure we dont end up chasing the market or scare off any potential buyers. This pricing strategy combined with our marketing will likely increase demand and result in a bidding war which will drive up the price. 

The second factor that will influence a successful home sale is maintenance. You want to make sure you have all those repairs or upgrades done before you list. Get new paint on the walls, make sure your yard looks great, and complete any other projects that will get your home in tip-top shape. 
A staged home sells 88% faster and for 20% more than a non-staged home.
Finally, make sure your home is decluttered and have it staged. One of the biggest complaints we hear from buyers is how much clutter is present during a home showing. So, its very important that you have decluttering taken care of. As far as staging goes, a staged home sells 88% faster and for 20% more than a non-staged home on average, so its something you definitely want to consider doing. 

If you have any further questions about this topic, or if you have any other real estate-related questions, please dont hesitate to give me a call or send me an email. I would be happy to help!

link.title: How to Sell Faster and for More Money

entry.title: Why Consider Buying Early in 2017?
entry.content:
Buying a home should be on your list of New Years resolutions. Heres why.

Selling your Birmingham home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Birmingham home? Search all homes for sale

If you havent already, you should make buying a home one of your New Years resolutions based on what we are seeing in the Birmingham market.

2017 is shaping up to be a great year in real estate. If your goal is to buy a home, you should start the process as soon as possible. We dont want you to postpone your goals for a few reasons, such as:
  • Consumer confidence is at an all-time high.
  • Unemployment is as low as it has been since August 2007. 
  • Most major markets have completely recovered from the mortgage and economic crisis.
Its a perfect storm for buyers.
Based on this information alone, its a great time to buy this year. However, there are two key factors that will make you want to move sooner rather than later:

1. Mortgage interest rates. The Federal Reserve recently upped their base interest rate, and all signs point to even more increases in 2017. When rates go up, it impacts your buying power significantly. We can get you in touch with some great mortgage lenders if you need a recommendation.

2. Inventory. Our supply of homes is getting lower than ever. We are sinking to record lows in desirable markets.

Even with those potential problems, we still think 2017 is a great time to make your resolution of buying a home a reality. If you have any questions, dont hesitate to give us a call or send us an email. We look forward to hearing from you.

entry.title: Big Opportunities in the 2017 Birmingham Market
entry.content:
The year is almost over, so we're seeing expert predictions for the 2017 real estate market start to pour in. Most of the experts share the same opinion for what the market will look like next year.  

Selling your Birmingham home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Birmingham home? Search all homes for sale

The year is winding down and I'm excited to share our 2017 real estate market forecast with you today. 

The market looks like it could be really hotscorching, you might say!

There's a lot of information going into this prediction from experts who are a lot smarter than I am, like the National Association of Realtors, the Mortgage Bankers Association, Fannie Mae, and Freddie Mac, to name a few. They're all predicting a hot year for home sales in 2017.

The NAR is predicting that home sales will reach 6 million next year after predicting 5.8 million homes sales this year. Other organizations predict well over 6 million home sales in 2017that would be a stronger market than we've seen in a long time.
All signs point to a strong, hot market in 2017.
So what's driving this trend?

First, the economy is solid and growing right now. Another big factor is Generation Y (millennials) finally entering the market after putting off homeownership in many cases. They typically buy later in life, but they're getting to the point of being a major driving force in the real estate market. When they drive up home sales, it will be great for the economy. 

This will also drive up your home's value. If you're even just thinking about selling your house, be sure to give us a call or send me an email soon. I'd love to talk you through all the opportunities the market will provide in 2017.

entry.title: How Do You Find the Right Inspector?
entry.content:
You shouldnt overlook the importance of a home inspector when buying a house. How do you find the right one for you?

Selling your Birmingham home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Birmingham home? Search all homes for sale

When you hire a home inspector, there are few distinct things you need to know.

First and foremost, the answer to the question Should we hire a home inspector? is absolutely yes. You also get to choose the home inspector. We will recommend a list of home inspectors to you if you want, because you need to hire a professional, not your uncle or cousin.

A professional inspector will give you pictures that we can use to negotiate repairs on the house. If we dont have that official formalized report, its much harder to do these negotiations on your behalf.
Not all inspectors are created equal.
So how do you choose an inspector and what questions should you ask? The one you hire will be based on conversations you have and how comfortable you are with them in helping you protect the future of your investment. You want to ask things like whether they actually get up on the roof or if they just take photos. Do they actually go up and find out whats going on in the attic? Also, ask them how they test things like electrical systems and heating and AC. 

Finally, realize that not all home inspectors are created equal. As you talk with them, compare costs to the value they present to you. An inspector may charge less, but they might not get in the attic or up on the roof, for example.

If you need a recommendation for a good inspector or youre thinking of buying or selling a home in the Birmingham market, give us a call or send us an email. Wed be happy to help you!

link.title: How Do You Find the Right Inspector?

entry.title: Why You Should Never Buy or Sell Without an Agent
entry.content:
Many people who think they dont need an agent underestimate how complicated a real estate transaction can be. Not only should you hire an agent, you should hire an expert agent. 

Selling your Birmingham home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Birmingham home? Search all homes for sale

You should never buy or sell a home without a real estate agent. I think there are a lot of people out there who get taken advantage of because they are unaware of what can happen during a transaction or because they work with an agent who is not an expert. Some agents are simply inexperienced or only working for the sale. These agents will not look out for your best interests. 

There are four things you should look for when hiring a real estate agent: 

1. Expertise: Look for someone who knows a lot about the market and will take the time to find out what youre looking for. A real estate agent should act as your consultant and advisor, not a salesperson. A good agent invests their time in finding the best transaction for you. They are not just trying to sell you a house so they can move on to the next deal. 

2. Search power: Real estate agents who treat this as our profession are networking constantly. We talk with sellers and other agents to find out exactly whats going on in the market. A lot of the time, we even have the ability to match up a buyer and a seller before the seller even puts their house on the market. Not all agents can do that. 
Your Realtor should act as your advisor and consultant.
3. Negotiating skills: A lot of Realtors may not be trained in negotiation. On my team, we take negotiating very seriously. In fact, we are all getting certified as negotiation experts so that we can provide extra value to you during your transaction. 

4. Connections: We are networking every day to find you the best lenders, home inspectors, pest inspectors, and contractors. No matter what you need for your home, we want to be able to connect you with someone who can take care of you and your property. 

Real estate transactions can be complicated, so its incredibly important that you find the right agent to work with. Dont just go in alone. If you have any questions about buying or selling a home, give us a call or send us an email. My team and I would be happy to help you!

link.title: Why You Should Never Buy or Sell Without an Agent

entry.title: Can You Sell a Home During Fall or Winter?
entry.content:
Thinking about selling your home? Contrary to popular belief, fall and winter are actually great times to get top dollar for your home.

Selling your Birmingham home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Birmingham home? Search all homes for sale

I feel pretty strongly that the fall and winter seasons are actually great times to sell your home. 

A lot of people worry that fewer homes sell in the fall and winter than in the spring and summer. While this may be true, the difference is due to the fact that not as many sellers have their homes on the market. If you look at Birmingham historically, it is a minuscule difference.

I was talking with some folks looking to get into the real estate business and I explained to them that homes in Birmingham sell at almost as high a rate in the slowest month as they do during the fastest month. It's only a difference of 50 to 60 houses, which may seem like a lot, but in terms of the 10,000 to 12,000 houses that sell in the Birmingham market each year, it's not that much of a difference.
You'll have less competition and higher demand.
If you sell in the fall or winter, you will have less competition and higher demand from buyers who are looking at homes. There are also a lot of people who are relocatingcompanies relocate around the first of the year to get people in for the next year.

Also, remember that interest rates are at an all-time low right now. There is no guarantee that they will stay low going into spring, so that buyer that may qualify for your house today may not qualify in a couple months. The demand for your home in the fall and winter will be a lot higher, which will allow you to collect more money for the sale of your house.

If you've been thinking about selling your home, I hope you found this information helpful. If you have any questions for us, don't hesitate to give us a call or send an email. We look forward to talking with you soon.

link.title: Can You Sell a Home During Fall or Winter?

entry.title: How to Live in Your Home While You Sell
entry.content:
Selling your Birmingham home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Birmingham home? Search all homes for sale

Im excited to give you four great tips today about how to sell your home for top dollar while still living in it. Its a dilemma many home sellers face, and these four tips will make things a little easier:

1. Start packing. Go ahead and get started. The move is coming eventually, and you might as well be prepared in advance.

2. Get the home squeaky clean. We all love living in our homes, but it can get hard sometimes to keep things squeaky clean. While youre showing your home, it needs to be squeaky clean to show well and make a good first impression on buyers.



These four tips will make things a little easier.



3. Maintain your privacy and safety. It amazes me that people will leave cash, jewelry, and other valuables out when they know that people are going to be walking through the home. Make sure anything thats valuable or dangerous is put away, locked up, and unavailable for people to see.

4. Clear your schedule. If you are trying to sell your home, youve got to make it available for people to see. You also need to be willing to be flexible, on a moments notice, to let people check it out.

entry.title: 4 Tips for Adding Value to Your Birmingham Home
entry.content:
Selling your Birmingham home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Birmingham home? Search all homes for sale

Before you list your home, there are four simple things you can do to add value to your property. First, improve your curb appeal. This is what buyers see when they first look at your home. Pay attention to landscaping. Are there any fresh flowers? Do you need to add rocks to flower beds? Does your front door need to be painted or replaced? Whatever you have to do, make sure the outside of your house looks great in order to capture the buyers attention. Next, declutter your home. As homeowners, we collect a ton of stuff over the years. You should get rid of all that extra stuff. Get it out of the house. Throw it away or put it in storage. Once your house is decluttered, it will feel larger.



Neutral colors appeal to more buyers than bright, bold colors.

You should also paint the interior of your home. Use light, neutral colors for the walls. Dont go crazy with bold colors; some people may like them but a lot of people dont. Going neutral with paint is your best chance at reaching the vast majority of people. Finally, update your faucets and fixtures. They do have a life cycle. One day, silver faucets and fixtures are popular, and before you know it, people are switching those out for bronze fixtures. Updating the fixtures can make you feel like you updated the whole bathroom. If you have any questions about adding value to your property or real estate in general, give me a call or send me an email. I would be happy to help you!

link.title: 4 Tips for Adding Value to Your Birmingham Home

entry.title: Why You Need a Buyers Agent in Birmingham
entry.content:
Selling your Birmingham home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Birmingham home? Search all homes for sale

I started out my real estate career working with buyers. Even today, I still see buyers making the same mistake. They approach the buying process without proper representation. Why is it so important to hire a buyers agent in Birmingham?

  1. A buyers agent represents you. They dont have any other interests other than your own. You have to compete with the listing agent, who serves as representation for the sellers.
  2. A buyers agent knows what homes are available. Theyre familiar with the MLS, especially which homes are newly listed. They interact with a real estate network you wouldn't otherwise have without their help.



    You need someone to help you stay focused!



  3. A buyers agent has connections in the industry. Beyond other agents, they know home inspectors, loan officers, and other professionals involved with the real estate process.
  4. A buyers agent helps you stay on track with your goals. There is so much involved with the buying process and its easy to lose track of your progress. You need someone to help you stay focused!

These are only four of many reasons why buyers agents are crucial in our marketplace. Dont make the mistake and not hire one!

If youre thinking about buying or selling a home in the surrounding Birmingham area, give me a call or send me an email. Id be happy to help you!

entry.title: What Do Rising Interest Rates Mean for Birmingham Home Sellers?
entry.content:
Selling your Birmingham home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Birmingham home? Search all homes for sale

Late last year the Fed met and raised interest rates for the first time in years. It was a small increase, but what many people don't understand is that even small interest rate increases have a huge impact on affordability.

We're predicting interest rates to rise slowly over the course of 2016 as the market continues to stabilize. Inventory is down and home values will continue to rise. Additionally, on-the-fence buyers are going to enter the market in order to make a purchase before rates increase significantly.


It all comes down to supply and demand when it comes to the pricing of homes. We already have a low inventory, and we're expecting an influx of buyers trying to avoid high interest rates. This is a perfect storm for sellers in our area; your home's value will likely be at a premium in 2016! 

If you have any thoughts of selling your home this year, now is the time to start looking into the process. Give us a call or shoot us an email at any time so we can start talking about how much we can get for your home! We look forward to helping you take advantage of these fabulous conditions soon!

entry.title: When Is the Best Time to Sell?
entry.content:
Selling your Birmingham home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Birmingham home? Search all homes for sale

Today I am excited to share with you a piece of wisdom Ive learned throughout my years in real estate. People think you need to wait until spring to sell, but that is a myth in real estate. So is the myth that the only time you can get top dollar is in the spring. Heres where that comes from.

Its true that there are a lot of home buyers out in the market in the spring, looking to purchase homes and move in by the end of summer. However, after extensive market research, we have found that buyers are always buying homes. If you look at the market totals over a 12-month cumulative period, there is minimal decrease in activity month-over-month. Its usually less than 1% in most months, which turns into maybe 50-70 buyers tops. 

In reality, we have had some of our best months during the holidays, because a lot of people are ready to buy at that time. If buyers are out looking at homes during the cold, dark winter months, they are serious and ready to make an offer if the right property comes along. 

If you are ready to sell, now is the time to list your home on the market and get top dollar. If you have any questions for us, or want to know more about how you can sell your home for top dollar, give us a call or send us an email. We look forward to hearing from you!

link.title: When Is the Best Time to Sell?

entry.title: Why Should Your Home Be Accessible to Buyers?
entry.content:
Selling your Birmingham home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Birmingham home? Search all homes for sale

If you are selling your home, one of the most important qualities you can have as a seller is flexibility. Today well talk about why its so important to make your home accessible for showings while its on the market. 

Its so important to make your home available for showings on a moments notice. You have put it on the market at this point, and we are doing everything in our power to get as many buyers as possible through the door, but the number one problem we run into is sellers not making the home available for buyers when they can see it. 


I know from experience how stressful it is to sell a home, but to sell effectively in todays market, youve got to be willing to accommodate last-minute showings. Its a huge risk to turn away even one buyer because they could be the one buyer you are looking for. Not making the home available for showings also frustrates home buyers and their agents. 

Besides pricing your home effectively from the get-go, the best piece of advice I can give you about selling your home is to not turn down any showings. You are just looking for that one perfect buyer, and they could come along at any time. 

If you have any questions for me or my team, feel free to give me a call or send me an email. We look forward to hearing from you soon!

entry.title: Can You Avoid These Common Real Estate Mistakes?
entry.content:
Selling your Birmingham home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Birmingham home? Search all homes for sale

 With the busy spring real estate season in full swing, there is no better time to discuss common home buying mistakes you should be aware of! Here are a few of the mistakes unwitting home buyers make:

  1. Relying on information found online: A lot of times, the information you find on the Internet is outdated or flat out inaccurate. If you want reliable real estate information, your best resource is a real estate professional.
  2. Failing to get pre-approved: If you submit an offer on a home that has garnered offers from other buyers, your offer will likely be rejected if it doesn't have a pre-approval letter from a lender along with it. If you have a pre-approval from a reputable lender, you offer is almost as good as a cash offer.
  3. Not knowing the market shifts frequently: Market conditions are constantly changing and are location dependent. About 24 months ago, it was a strong buyer's market; prospective buyers could make various requests that the seller would likely fulfill. Now, there are a ton of buyers out there looking for a home! To get good information so you make informed decisions, you need to speak with a real estate professional!
  4. Getting Picky: If you get picky about paying a few extra dollars on a home, you're giving up the lifestyle that you and your family deserve. Keep in mind that in a few years you'll probably not mind paying the extra money for the home because you and your family deserve it.

    Avoiding these mistakes is crucial if you want the buying process to go smoothly. Give us a call or shoot us an email if you need real estate assistance of any kind. We would love to give you a hand!

link.title: Can You Avoid These Common Real Estate Mistakes?

entry.title: What Real Estate Agents Do to Keep Protected
entry.content:
Selling your Birmingham home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Birmingham home? Search all homes for sale

Recently there have been some unsettling things in the news that involve the safety of real estate agents, so I just wanted to take a moment to explain how we take precautions to safeguard ourselves in this line of work. What we do is inherently dangerous, but we can take steps to avoid bad situations.

One of the things we avoid doing is meeting a prospective client at a house before we've met them. We always insist that you come speak with us at our office before we take you to a listing. We just ask that you consider how you'd feel if your wife, daughter or son were being asked to meet a stranger in a vacant house. It's just not a safe situation at all. 

This is why we like to screen our potential buyers, so we can ensure that they're serious about buying and do not have any other intentions. Other than safety concerns, we think the experience you have with us is always much better when you come in and meet us, because that gives us the opportunity to cater to all of your individual needs. Almost all of the problems that arise in a real estate transaction will come from a lack of communication, and this can be avoided with a consultation at the beginning of a home search.

If you ever need any help buying or selling homes in Birmingham, please don't hesitate to contact me. I'm always willing to help you!

entry.title: What Are the Benefits of Using an Agent?
entry.content:
There are many great Birmingham area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Value Report so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at 205-536-9194 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

We know what you're thinking: "You're an agent, OF COURSE you think it's a great idea to hire one." However, it's not that simple - there are a number of reasons working with an agent is in your best interests.
  • Safety: We ensure that you only work with qualified buyers. You don't want to invite a stranger to your home who has not proved they're serious about purchasing your home.
  • Every buyer wants a deal: Buyers and their agents are going to do everything in their power to beat you down and get the best deal possible. Having a listing agent on your side makes all the difference.
  • Your best interests are represented: If the buyer is working with an agent and you're not, they will have the upper hand in negotiations. An agent will help you negotiate and will keep your wants and needs in mind.
  • Experience: An agent will ensure that all the "i's" are dotted and "t's" are crossed. They will oversee all the details of the transactions and work to complete the sale successfully so you can move on to your next venture.
These are just a few of the reasons working with agent is beneficial. If you're still not sold, give us a call or shoot us an email - we would be happy to show you everything we can do for you!

entry.title: Looking for a Safe Investment Opportunity?
entry.content:
There are many great Birmingham area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Value Report so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at 205-536-9194 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

There are a lot of places where you can invest your hard-earned money - but not all of them are guaranteed to make you money. Purchasing real estate, however, is a pretty safe bet for a few reasons. Here are 4 reasons why becoming a home owner is one of the best financial decisions you can make:
  1. You're going to pay to live somewhere: If you are renting, you are basically throwing your money away. By purchasing a home, you are not only paying to live somewhere, but nurturing an investment that will be of worth to you down the road.
  2. Forced savings: By making monthly mortgage payments, you are saving yourself future living expenses.  You are building equity, which is invaluable.
  3. Great way to hedge inflation: When you buy a home its value increases as time goes on. If you lock in historically low interest rates now, you will be protecting yourself against future inflation.
  4. Tax savings: You can deduct your mortgage interest from your taxes, which is a benefit you don't get when you rent.
These are only a handful of the many benefits of home ownership. If you have any questions about this topic or are interested in making a move here in Birmingham, give us a call or shoot us an email. We would love to make your dreams of home ownership come true!

link.title: Looking for a Safe Investment Opportunity?

entry.title: Take the necessary steps before making your offer
entry.content:

Today's topic is of the utmost importance, especially if you find yourself in a multiple-offer situation. If you want to ensure you get the home of your dreams you need to get full-approval before making an offer (note: some lenders might call it conditional approval). Here's why:
  • Makes you look like a cash buyer to the seller.
  • Can help you negotiate a lower price.
  • Makes your offer look better.
  • Lets the seller know you are serious.
  • Gives you a lot more leverage in negotiations.
All of these things make you a more competitive buyer, which is important if you want to get your offer accepted. The pre-approval process doesn't take too much extra effort. It's simply a matter of being proactive about getting the necessary documents to your lender before you start making offers.

You should know that all lenders won't necessarily give you full-approval. We can put you in contact with lenders that will because we are 100% committed to making sure you take every measure to get the best possible scenario when buying a home. Give us a call or send us an email to take the preemptive measures necessary to avoid losing the home of your dreams.

Today, we're going to talk about the home search websites Trulia and Zillow. While they provide some value during the information gathering stage, they are ultimately full of inaccuracies and misinformation.  These sites are not intentionally misleading but they can ultimately lead you astray for a number of reasons:
  • There is often a lag in the information they provide - sometimes as much as 3 days.
  • Evaluations are often inaccurate, as they don't utilize the same information an agent does.
  • Homes are often listed on these sites that are either under contract or no longer unavailable.
These are just a few examples that demonstrate why it's wiser to hire a trusted real estate adviser in your market. Sit down with an agent and let them establish your home search - they can help you determine what you're looking for in a home, and have access to information Trulia and Zillow do not. entry.content:
There are many great Birmingham area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Value Report so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (205) 281-6641 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

March 2014 Birmingham Market Update

For this installment of my blog, I'm going to get you updated on the market here in Birmingham so you can hit the ground running this spring when the market begins to bloom.

  • In the past 30 days, there was a 9% decrease in the amount of homes sold.
    • However, there was a 3% increase in the selling price of those homes. 
  • This leads me to believe that our market is rebounding, and I expect a good year for us here in Birmingham.
    • If you've had trouble selling your home in the past, then this might be a lucky year for you. Low interest rates will be spurring buyers to purchase homes this year, so I expect to see a lot of market activity on both sides.
  • Property values are still not back up to what they used to be a few years ago, but once again this will cause buyers to purchase homes. It's not a sterling situation for sellers, but if you've been having trouble selling, then this could actually aid you.
  • Inventory has steadily been decreasing and pushing our Birmingham market towards a more neutral market.
    • I expect in the next 12-18 months to see the market shift again towards a seller's market as inventory decreases.
      • So, if you're looking to buy a home, you'll want to do it soon. 
So whether you're buying or selling here in Birmingham, you're going to find a market that will suit your needs. Sellers will be happy with a relatively low inventory that will bring them multiple offers, and buyers will be happy with lower mortgage rates and home values.
If you have any interest in buying or selling a home, or just want to know what's going on in our area, feel free to contact me at your convenience. You can call me at (205) 281-6641 or email me at Jason@JasonSecor.com
